laboratory_examinations.findings: There is T2 hyperintense signal around the gallbladder fossa with subtle parenchymal hyperemia. The liver is otherwise homogeneous in signal intensity without suspicious mass. Moderate signal drop on out of phase imaging is consistent with hepatic steatosis (fat fraction 17%). No ascites noted. The gallbladder is notable for cholelithiasis and sludge, mildly dilated with heterogeneous enhancement and mild pericholecystic free fluid with gallbladder wall edema.
